title: ERA (Electronic Remittance Advice) Schema
description:
Implement ERA (Electronic Remittance Advice) File Processing Schema

Design and implement a database schema to handle ERA file processing, including payment information capture and reconciliation tracking for healthcare claims remittance.

Requirements:
- Define core ERA file metadata table (file ID, submission date, payer information, file format version)
- Create payment transaction table to store individual payment details (claim ID, payment amount, adjustment codes, dates)
- Implement reconciliation tracking table to link ERA payments with claims and track reconciliation status
- Add adjustment and remark code reference tables to normalize denial/adjustment reasons
- Include audit fields (created_at, updated_at, processed_by) for all tables
- Define relationships and foreign keys between ERA files, payments, and claims
- Add indexes on frequently queried fields (claim ID, payer ID, payment date, reconciliation status)
- Support batch processing by tracking file-level totals vs. sum of individual payments
- Include validation rules for data integrity (payment amounts, required fields, status transitions)
- Document schema with clear field descriptions and expected data formats

Edge Cases to Consider:
- Handling multiple payments for the same claim
- Partial payments and split payments across multiple ERAs
- Voided or corrected payments
- Unmatched payments that don't correspond to existing claims
- ERA file reprocessing and duplicate prevention
